post.body: Look into the Craft Alliance in U. City; every class I've taken there has been excellent.
Maybe one day In-N-Out will come to the midwest one day.
Say hi to everybody for me. This "darn" Israel trip is getting in the way of my fun!
Considering that I probably can't get a dish with both meat and dairy over there, that's a great idea.
Either I'll need to cut off my toes or we'll need to stretch your shoes out to a size 9.5 or 10. Thank you though!
I own tons of Patagonia light weight long underwear, so I'm bringing it. I guess I need to bring soap for laundry in the sink!
Agreed; it's going to be freezing in the mountains and very warm in the desert.
Thank you, I'm crashing in beautiful Jamaica, NY (BLECH) Sunday night before my flight to Tel Aviv.
Don't get salmonella!
What's in the packet?
Tweetup with the Sen, ha ;)
don't use margarine; use Israeli olive oil! Miss you!
tel aviv next week
My mom wants me to bring her a shofar. They sound expensive.
Not bringing a computer to Israel; too much to see and do to use one.
It's just tough because I had to pack for hiking in snowy mountains and spending some days in the desert.
Glad she's OK - sometimes a virus can do icky things to kids. Hopefully you can flush it out with fluids.
My roommate is training for the full marathon; he's working hard. Big commitment.
Hila told me in a Facebook message.
I figured you were still sleeping it off ("it" being Israel)
search youtube for the video; it rocks
and bacon cheeseburgers! (Just kidding!)
I don't go back to the office until next Tuesday after 3 weeks away; I will have to reintroduce myself to my coworkers!
I've sworn off falafel for at least the next 6 months; I overdosed on it in Jerusalem
Thanks! It's fairly isolated to one area that I didn't visit. Odd but I still felt safer there than in STL.
Ragan always has good conferences.
How about we do it tomorrow or Wednesday; my appetite has disappeared and I really want to savor the RED MEAT!
It breaks my heart; I so wish the story was true.
Watching my friend graduate in Michigan via webcam is nice except that he's graduating with 1,000 people in non-alphabetical order.
Watching my best friend graduate from my computer since I can't be in Michigan this weekend: http://is.gd/bvOC
Yay @nickganga! It is so cool that I can watch your graduation from my computer: www.nickganga.com
What would you eat for your last American dinner before leaving the country for a while?
Don't criticize my use of a cell phone & not a landline when I wake up early on a Saturday to consult with you on your non-profit's Web site
Evidently I need non-flip-flop water shoes for the Dead Sea; there's no way I'm buying shoes for a 30 minute swim. I'll risk it w flip-flops
Packing for a multi-week trip without the possibility of doing laundry is difficult; who owns 2.5 weeks worth of travel clothes anyway?
Helping @nickganga with his Google Policy Fellowship essay.
Frosty the Snowman, the classic 1969 cartoon, is on CBS right now. Check it out.
Back from a night in Tiberias. Tomorrow going to Tzfat (home of Kabbalah) and joining with 8 IDF soldiers who are joining our travel group.
Just finished offroad jeeping in northern israel
Good morning! Off to hike near the country of Jordan and the off-road jeeping.
Good night from the Lower Galilee.
The food in Israel so far is awesome; imagine Whole Foods but authentic.
On a bus, headed north from Tel Aviv to a city called Tibiras for the night.
Just landed at the Tel Aviv airport - slept for 4 of the 10 hour flight! Israel, here I come.
Goodbye for the next two weeks; wish me luck and good times in Israel!
The plane is so big, it has a spiral staircase INSIDE! How does this thing fly?!
I'm getting all emotional about going to the Middle East.
I was just told that we aren't allowed to drink on the plane; my program's rules. Gag me, how do you fly 10 hours without a glass of wine?
Made it through El Al security; they were convinced that I had a knife in my bag. It was my UMBRELLA!
The kid next to me in line is on Twitter too; this trip will be OK.
Just met the group I'm traveling with; evidently it's against some religious law to shake hands. Lots to learn...
I wouldn't look odd wearing 2 hooded sweatshirts, 2 pairs of sweatpants and 2 pairs of shorts on the plane; would I?
This is one of the reasons why I felt safer in Israel; my neighbor's car was stolen when we were outside tonight. WTF.
My friend Guy, a soldier with the IDF, is going to Gaza tomorrow: http://susanisk.com/images/susanguy.jpg
Going to hang out with @broodman in the Loop
Coldplay song Viva La Vida says, "I hear Jerusalem bells ringing." I didn't hear ANY bells while I was there...
I'm looking for an MP3 of Ben Folds' cover of Such Great Heights; not having much luck.
Upgraded to WordPress 2.7 for susanisk.com; wow, the new look is shocking but very welcome!
The one thing Israel is missing is Trader Joe's.
Just bought a pair of Ugg moccasins; I don't care if they're "out," I plan to wear them to work every day until winter ends.
